revision.text:
{{Infobox person | birth_name = Adam Patrick DeVine | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1983|11|7}} | image = Adam Devine 2013 (cropped).jpg | caption = DeVine at the 2013 [[San Diego Comic-Con]]. | birth_place = [[Waterloo, Iowa]], U.S. | occupation = {{Flat list| *Actor *voice actor *comedian *singer *screenwriter *producer}} | years_active = 2006–present }} '''Adam Patrick DeVine''' (born November 7, 1983){{cite web|url=https://www.twitter.com/ADAMDEVINE/status/398611948704522241|title=Tweet from DeVine's verified account regarding his birthday|publisher=[[Twitter]]|first=Adam|last=DeVine|date=November 7, 2013|accessdate=May 12, 2014}}{{cite news|url=http://www.omaha.com/article/20130809/GO/308099869 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20131016111731/http://www.omaha.com/article/20130809/GO/308099869 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=October 16, 2013 |title=Adam DeVine, Omaha native, scores recurring role in 'Modern Family' |work=[[Omaha World-Herald]] |first=Bob |last=Fishbach |date=August 9, 2013 |accessdate=May 26, 2015 }} is an American actor, voice actor, comedian, singer, screenwriter and producer. He is a star and co-creator of the [[Comedy Central]] series ''[[Workaholics]]'', as well as ''[[Adam DeVine's House Party]]''.{{cite web|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/tv/news/q-a-the-workaholic-life-of-adam-devine-20140304|title=Q&A: The 'Workaholic' Life of Adam DeVine|work=[[Rolling Stone]]|first=Charles|last=Thorp|date=March 4, 2014|accessdate=May 15, 2015}} He plays the role of Bumper in the musical films ''[[Pitch Perfect]]'' and ''[[Pitch Perfect 2]]'' and Andy in the sitcom ''[[Modern Family]]''. His other roles include ''[[Neighbors (2014 film)|Neighbors]]'', ''[[The Intern (2015 film)|The Intern]]'', ''[[The Final Girls]]'', ''[[Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates]]'', ''[[Game Over, Man!]]'' and ''[[When We First Met]]''. He has voiced characters in films including ''[[Ice Age: Collision Course]]'' and ''[[The Lego Batman Movie]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.esquire.com/entertainment/movies/interviews/a35031/adam-devine-pitch-perfect-2-interview/|title=Adam Devine on Singing in Public, Gangster-Rapping Wizards, and Romantic Gestures|work=[[Esquire (magazine)|Esquire]]|first=Emily|last=Zemler}} DeVine has voiced characters on animated series ''[[Uncle Grandpa]]'' and ''[[Penn Zero: Part-Time Hero]]''. ==Early life== DeVine was born in [[Waterloo, Iowa]],{{cite web|url=http://wcfcourier.com/entertainment/waterloo-native-becomes-a-workaholic/article_6a50362c-45ec-11e1-8f4f-0019bb2963f4.html|title=Waterloo Native Becomes a 'Workaholic'|first=Amie|last=Steffen|date=January 23, 2012|work=Waterloo Cedar Falls Courier|accessdate=September 5, 2015}} the son of Dennis and Penny DeVine. He graduated from [[Millard South High School]] in [[Omaha, Nebraska]], in 2002.{{citation needed|date=September 2016}} He attended [[Orange Coast College]], along with friend and fellow cast member [[Blake Anderson]].{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gt9VaUl_G8E|title=Adam DeVine on YouTube|publisher=[[YouTube]]|accessdate=December 31, 2013}} He later moved to [[Los Angeles]], where he began working as a stand up comedian and actor.{{cite web|url=http://www.nationallampoon.com/lemmings/bio_adam.html|title=National Lampoon Lemmings Comedy Troupe!|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111220040931/http://www.nationallampoon.com/lemmings/bio_adam.html|archivedate=December 20, 2011|publisher=National Lampoon|accessdate=July 22, 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.mailordercomedy.com/bios.html|title=Bios|publisher=Mail Order Comedy|date=April 6, 2011|accessdate=July 22, 2012}} ===1995 accident=== In June 1995, when he was 11 years old, DeVine was walking his bike across a street in Omaha, Nebraska. After he waited for three cement trucks to pass, a fourth truck, previously blocked by opposing traffic, struck him. DeVine went under the first two wheels of the 42 ton cement truck and slid 500 feet. He was knocked unconscious, went into [[acute shock]] and was in a [[coma]]. He was rushed to [[intensive care]], where he woke up two weeks later. He broke all the bones in both legs, had a [[collapsed lung]], developed multiple infections, and it was unknown whether he would ever walk again. Over several years, he had 26 surgeries and spent much of the time using a wheelchair. Due to the extent of his injuries, DeVine was at very high risk of having to have his legs amputated, and having [[multiple organ failure]]. He regained full mobility but still has extensive scarring on his legs.{{cite web|url=http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/adam-devine/bio/324819|title=Adam DeVine Biography|work=[[TV Guide]]|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130115183122/http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/adam-devine/bio/324819|archivedate=January 15, 2013}}{{cite web|url= http://ew.com/article/2016/07/08/adam-devine-origin-story-getting-hit-cement-truck/|title= Adam Devine's origin story|work= EW}} "It was really tough because I had to relearn how to walk, stand up, sit up and everything," DeVine described. "The legs were totally mangled. I think that experience helped me realize that anything is possible."{{cite web|url= http://www.ketv.com/article/adam-devine-visits-unl-to-promote-new-movie-1/7659841|title= Adam Devine visits UNL to promote new movie}} To pass the time DeVine called into his local radio station and impersonated celebrities to entertain himself and others. Upon returning to school, DeVine experienced bullying, but told jokes as a way to deflect attention away from his injuries. All this, he said, contributed to how he saw comedy as a way of bringing people together. It was later discovered that the reason he was not killed was because his bike was on his right side, and thus took the full force of the truck. ==Career== In 2006, DeVine and friends [[Blake Anderson]], [[Anders Holm]], and [[Kyle Newacheck]] formed the sketch-comedy group Mail Order Comedy. Although they toured together live, the group found greater success on websites such as [[Myspace]] and [[YouTube]]. The [[G4 (U.S. TV channel)|G4]] series ''[[Attack of the Show!]]'' featured "Wizards Never Die", a music video by Mail Order Comedy (as The Wizards), in April 2008. ''Purple Magic'', a music album by The Wizards containing 14 tracks, was released on April 1, 2009.{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/dp/B003ESSTAS|title=Purple Magic [Explicit]|publisher=[[Amazon.com]]|asin=B003ESSTAS}} [[Comedy Central]]'s original series ''[[Workaholics]]'' premiered on April 6, 2011, and stars DeVine, Anderson, and Holm and co-stars Newacheck, all of whom also serve as series creators and executive producers. DeVine had small roles in ''[[Mama's Boy]]'' (2007) and ''[[National Lampoon's 301: The Legend of Awesomest Maximus]]'' (2009). He had a recurring role on the television series ''[[Samantha Who?]]''. He also appeared on an episode of the [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]] show ''[[Traffic Light (TV series)|Traffic Light]]'' (2011). In season 4 of ''[[Community (TV series)|Community]]'' (2013), he played a small role as William Winger, Jr., Jeff's half-brother. In the first episode of ''[[Arrested Development (TV series)|Arrested Development]]''{{'s}} fourth season, he played an airport ticket attendant alongside his ''Workaholics'' co-stars. He co-starred as Bumper Allen in the 2012 musical comedy film ''[[Pitch Perfect]]''. For this performance, he won a [[Teen Choice Award]] for [[Teen Choice Award for Best Villain|Choice Movie Villain]] and earned one nomination for Choice Movie Breakout.{{cite web|url=http://www.tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2013/08/11/teen-choice-2013-winners-announced/196915 |title='Teen Choice 2013' Winners Announced |work=[[TV by the Numbers]] |publisher=[[Zap2it]] |first=Robert |last=Seidman |date=August 11, 2013 |accessdate=September 30, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130915010049/http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2013/08/11/teen-choice-2013-winners-announced/196915/ |archivedate=September 15, 2013 }}{{cite web|url=http://www.tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2013/07/01/second-wave-of-nominations-heat-up-teen-choice-2013-airing-sunday-august-11-on-fox/189805/ |title=Second Wave of Nominations Heat Up 'Teen Choice 2013' |work=[[TV by the Numbers]] |publisher=[[Zap2it]] |first=Amanda |last=Kondolojy |date=July 1, 2013 |accessdate=September 30, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131016163428/http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2013/07/01/second-wave-of-nominations-heat-up-teen-choice-2013-airing-sunday-august-11-on-fox/189805/ |archivedate=October 16, 2013 }} He reprised the role of Bumper in the film's sequel ''[[Pitch Perfect 2]]'' (2015). DeVine has appeared in the ''[[SimCity (2013 video game)|SimCity]]'' video game trailers as The Mayor. DeVine is the voice artist for the character Pizza Steve in the [[Cartoon Network]] animated series ''[[Uncle Grandpa]]'', which premiered on September 2, 2013. He stars in his own [[Comedy Central]] series, ''[[Adam DeVine's House Party]]'', which debuted in October 2013.{{cite web|url=http://www.variety.com/2013/tv/news/comedy-central-plans-house-party-with-adam-devine-1200348424|title=Comedy Central Plans 'House Party' with Adam DeVine|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|first=AJ|last=Marechal|date=April 11, 2013|accessdate=September 29, 2013}} He also appears in a recurring role in seasons 5, 6 and 7 of the ABC network sitcom ''[[Modern Family]]'' as Andy, the Pritchett family's nanny.{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/culture/2013/jul/09/comedian-adam-devine-workaholics-interview|title=Adam DeVine's advice for young people: 'Don't go to college, follow your dreams'|work=[[The Guardian]]|first=Amanda|last=Holpuch|accessdate=May 15, 2015}} In 2016, he starred alongside [[Zac Efron]], playing brothers, in the comedy film ''[[Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/adam-devine-star-opposite-zac-777501|title=Adam DeVine Joins Zac Efron For New Comedy|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|first=Borys|last=Kit|date=February 24, 2015}} DeVine also made a cameo appearance in the video for the 2016 [[Blink-182]] song "[[She's Out of Her Mind]]". In 2018, DeVine played the lead, Noah Ashby, in the romantic comedy ''[[When We First Met]]'', which he also co-wrote.{{cite news|last1=Pedersen|first1=Erik|title=Adam Devine & Alexandra Daddario Will Reminisce About ‘When We First Met’|url=http://deadline.com/2016/05/adam-devine-alexandra-daddario-when-first-we-met-ari-sandel-1201750999/|accessdate=July 20, 2016|work=Deadline|date=May 6, 2016}} His co-stars include [[Alexandra Daddario]], [[Shelley Hennig]] and [[Robbie Amell]]. Also that year, Devine, Anderson, and Holm starred in the film ''[[Game Over, Man!]]'', with Newacheck directing and Newacheck and [[Seth Rogen]] among its producers.{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/workaholics-creators-seth-rogen-team-901191|title=Workaholics Creators, Seth Rogen Team for Action Comedy 'Game Over, Man! |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=June 6, 2016}} On November 2, 2016, DeVine was cast as the lead of [[Walt Disney Pictures]] family-film ''[[Magic Camp (film)|Magic Camp]]'', alongside [[Jeffrey Tambor]] and [[Gillian Jacobs]]. DeVine plays Andy Tuckerman, a failed magician who goes back to the camp of his youth to mentor a rag-tag bunch of magicians. {{cite news|last1=Kroll|first1=Justin|title=Adam DeVine and Jeffrey Tambor to Star in Disney’s ‘Magic Camp’|url=https://variety.com/2016/film/news/adam-devine-and-jeffrey-tambor-to-star-in-disneys-magic-camp-1201907225/|accessdate=November 3, 2016|work=Variety|date=November 2, 2016}} Principal photography began in December, 2016 around Los Angeles.{{cite news|last1=Evry|first1=Max|title=Magic Camp Begins Production with Jeffrey Tambor|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/movies/news/801801-disneys-magic-camp-begins-production-starring-jeffrey-tambor|accessdate=January 11, 2017|work=ComingSoon.net|date=January 10, 2017}} The film is scheduled for release April 6, 2019.{{cite news|last1=Lesnick|first1=Silas|title=Disney Movie Release Schedule Gets a Major Update|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/movies/news/841525-disney-movie-schedule|accessdate=April 25, 2017|work=ComingSoon.net|date=April 25, 2017}} in May, 2017, DeVine was cast alongside [[Rebel Wilson]] and [[Liam Hemsworth]] in the romantic comedy ''[[Isn't It Romantic (2019 film)|Isn't It Romantic]]''. This film marks the fourth time that DeVine and Wilson have played love interests, after ''[[Workaholics]]'', ''[[Pitch Perfect]]'' and ''[[Pitch Perfect 2]]''.{{cite news|last1=Kit|first1=Borys|title=Adam Devine, Liam Hemsworth Join Rebel Wilson in 'Isn't It Romantic' (Exclusive)|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/adam-devine-liam-hemsworth-join-rebel-wilson-isnt-romantic-1002480|accessdate=July 11, 2017|work=The Hollywood Reporter|date=May 10, 2017|language=en}} ==Personal Life== DeVine is a big supporter of [[Children’s Miracle Network Hospitals]], a not-for-profit organisation that raises funds for children’s hospitals across America. As he was in fact treated by a children’s hospital as a child, DeVine attends charity events and visits the children, with his story of survival providing comfort to the patients and their parents. cite web | url=https://www.instagram.com/p/BcDW3cylDXG/?utm_source=ig_share_sheet&igshid=1b39pl5tx04yl|accessdate= August 23,2018|date= November 29,2017|work= Instagram|}} He also regularly takes part in [[USO]] tours, providing entertainment for military personnel across the world, and describes it as “the most rewarding experience of my life.” cite web {{|url= https://www.3newsnow.com/news/local-news/omaha-native-devine-dad-recap-uso-holiday-tour| news|last1=Wasikowski|first1=Jake|date=January 4, 2018|accessdate=August 23, 2018|work=3NewsNow|}} . After meeting in 2014 on set, DeVine began dating his [[The Final Girls]] co-star [[Chloe Bridges]] in February 2015. cite web{{|url= https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/adam-devine-dating-pretty-little-liars-chloe-bridges-details-2015172/| last1=Webber|first1=Stephanie|work=Us Weekly|date=February 17,2015|accessdate=August 23,2018|}} ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !
